      • addLabel

        public void addLabel(java.lang.String label)
        Adds the given label to the card and recomputes the DataManager's label information. Adding a label already attached to the card has no effect.
        Parameters:
        label - the label to add

      • removeLabel

        public void removeLabel(java.lang.String label)
        Removes the given label from the card and recomputes the DataManager's label information. Attempting to remove a label not associated with this card has no effect.
        Parameters:
        label - the label to remove

      • mouseAtPoint

        public void mouseAtPoint(java.awt.Point p,
                         int selectionType)
        Mouse is dragged at the given point. If there is a box under the mouse, it is marked selected.
        Parameters:
        p - mouse point
        selectionType - CRectangle STUDY_SELECTED or EDIT_SELECTED depending on the context

      • dropAnswerAt

        public java.lang.String dropAnswerAt(java.lang.String userAnswer,
                                     java.awt.Point p,
                                     boolean allowWrongAnswers,
                                     boolean deselectAfterDrop)
        Displays the answer in the box containing the point if the supplied answer is correct. If allowWrongAnswers is set to true, the box containing the point will display the supplied string whether or not it is correct. If there is already a string in the box and allowWrongAnswers is true, the given string will replace that answer already there.

        If the box is part of a group, the answer will first try to stick to the given box. If the given box already displays text, the answer will search through the boxes in the group to find one not displaying text. If every box in the group is displaying text, the answer will replace the text in the given box.

        The return is whatever string should be sent back to the answer box. If the given string is successfully placed into an empty box, null is returned. If given the string is dropped on a box that won't accept it or dropped onto empty space, the given string is returned. If the given string is dropped onto a box that will accept it and an answer is already there, the answer that the given string replaces is returned.

        Parameters:
        userAnswer - String dropped by user at point
        p - point at which answer was dropped
        allowWrongAnswers - if true, box will hold an answer even if wrong; if false, vice-versa
        Returns:
        the answer that should be sent back to the answer box, or null if none should be

      • dropAnswerAt

        public java.lang.String dropAnswerAt(java.lang.String userAnswer,
                                     christopher.CRectangle box,
                                     boolean allowWrongAnswers,
                                     boolean deselectAfterDrop)
        See notes for Card.dropAnswerAt(String,Point,boolean). The difference is the second parameter: this method uses the given box rather than finding the box under the given point
